section.title: Requirements
section.para:
In this chapter the requirements for the BioPreDyn software framework are summarized; for more information about these requirements please refer to the integrated software suite requirements and the
graphical user interface requirements guides.

section.title: Engine requirements

formalpara.title: Systems biology model building cycle implementation
formalpara.para: The chosen architecture should allow as many systems biology model building steps as possible to be implemented and executed.

formalpara.title: Modularity
formalpara.para: The chosen architecture should allow any combination of steps from the systems biology model building cycle to be executed; in addition, the user should be given the possibility of choosing between different simulation engines for each step if multiple tools exist for this step.

formalpara.title: Standard languages
formalpara.para: In order to be easily interfaced with other tools, the integrated software suite should be compatible with reference biochemical model and data formats.

formalpara.title: Validation cases
formalpara.para: The chosen architecture and implementation should be validated using relevant use cases from the systems biology, ideally taken from the BioPreDyn project benchmark models.

section.para: From this requirements, it was decided to use the Simulation Experiment Description Markup Language (SED-ML) as a way to describe simulation work flows; and that the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML) would be the main language for encoding models. The following design reflects this decision.

formalpara.title: Work flow manipulation
formalpara.para:
The chosen interface should allow the user to:
Open a SED-ML file and build its corresponding work flow
Display the elements of a work flow
Execute a work flow
Save a work flow

formalpara.title: Graphical outputs
formalpara.para: The chosen interface should be capable of displaying the graphical outputs resulting from the execution of a SED-ML work flow.

formalpara.title: Written reports
formalpara.para: The user should be allowed to write the numerical values resulting from the execution of a work flow on disk in an appropriate format.

formalpara.title: Editing work flow elements
formalpara.para: The chosen interface should provide tools for editing any element of a work flow.
